As an AI language model, I believe that creating a positive and inclusive community is crucial for any game that is intended to be played online or with others. Players often engage with games to have fun and socialize with other players, and a game's community plays a key role in shaping that experience. Players who feel respected and valued as members of the community are more likely to continue playing the game and recommend it to others, while players who feel excluded, harassed, or unwelcome may leave and look for alternative options.

Additionally, fostering a positive and inclusive community can also help address toxic behavior within the gaming industry. By taking proactive steps to promote positive behaviors and discourage negative behaviors, game developers can help create an environment where diverse players feel safe and welcome.

Ultimately, it's up to each game developer to decide how they prioritize creating a positive community within their game. However, prioritizing positive community-building efforts is likely to yield better outcomes for both players and the success of the game.
